item.title: Arch Update Gets Locked
item.description:
If your Arch Package manager gets locked

This is an issue that I have encountered multiple times. Sometimes the @arch linux package gets locked so we need to unlock it using `sudo rm /var/lib/pacman/db.lck``

item.title: Github and Bitbucket setup
item.description:
Go to the .git repository and change the url from https:// to ssh://git@github.com:xxx/ Need to remember that the bitbucket also accepts this:

git@bitbucket.org:<repo_owner>/.git

Now one is ready to test it in any repository Good to go

The following to be done before

item.title: Jrnl - Manage your notes and journal entries from Command line
item.description:
Making alias for @jrnl - j in my zsh. Earlier it was aliased to ‘jobs-l’.

Basic Usage

jrnl has two modes: composing and viewing. Basically, whenever you don’t supply any arguments that start with a dash or double-dash, you’re in composing mode, meaning you can write your entry on the command line or an editor of your choice.

We intentionally break a convention on command line arguments: all arguments starting with a single dash will filter your journal before viewing it, and can be combined arbitrarily. Arguments with a double dash will control how your journal is displayed or exported and are mutually exclusive (ie. you can only specify one way to display or export your journal at a time).
